active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate how unmanaged stress during a live ransomware incident could cascade into errors (e.g., overlooked evidence in forensics), and propose 2-3 team-level interventions drawing from NIST frameworks or first-responder psychology studies. Justify using real-world IR examples.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in non-technical skills like Stress Management in Incident Response Team Organization (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > 002_Incident Response Team Organization > 009_Skills and Training > Non-Technical Skills > Stress Management). Consensus-approved (100%) with voter priorities on Bloom's Taxonomy, 4-layer scaffolding, IR-specific techniques (mindfulness, peer support, debriefs), NIST SP 800-61 integration, SANS resources, and first-responder psychology. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (10 per Bloom's pair: Remember/Understand, Apply/Analyze, Evaluate/Create; balanced across 4 scaffolding layers). Optimize for Anki/spaced repetition: active recall, no hints on front. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL LAYERS FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Tie explanations to activities (e.g., 'Apply in problem-solving exercise'). - Research: Stress sources (time pressure), techniques (deep breathing, rotations), impacts (burnout/errors), NIST 800-61 phases. Output EXACTLY in JSON array of objects per flashcard_schema: { "front": "Question...", "back": { "answer": "...", "explanation": "...", "bloom_level": "Remember", "scaffolding_layer": "Layer 1", "distractors": ["D1 (why wrong: ...)", "D2 (...)", "D3 (...)"] } } Vary formats: 40% MCQ (w/ distractors), 30% cloze, 30% short answer. Ensure university pedagogy: progressive complexity, misconception-busting distractors.
